conbody.p: Quota statements and general permission statements are evaluated separately. A request has to pass both checks in order to get the final access to the resource.
Eucalyptus uses the following logic for evaluating quotas:

ol.li: If the request user is system administrator (that is, any user in the eucalyptus account), access is granted.

Collect quota statements at all levels (user, group, and account) and match the request by checking the Principal, the Action/NotAction, and the Resource/NotResource elements of the statements. This process is similar to general permission statement matching.
Collect all quota keys from the matching statements. For each quota key, if there are multiple values from different statements, choose the smallest value.
Evaluate each quota key and compare with the picked value. If any one of quota keys evaluates a value larger than its picked value in step 3, access is DENIED. Otherwise, access is GRANTED.
